dt: {bc}an animal (such as a domestic rabbit or cat) showing a genetic recessive variation in which the guard hairs are very short, sparse, or entirely lacking {dx}compare {dxt|cornish rex||}, {dxt|devon rex||}{/dx}

et: modification of French {it}castorrex, castorex{/it}, a variety of rabbit, perhaps from Latin {it}castor{/it} beaver + {it}rex{/it} king {ma}{mat|castor|}, {mat|royal|}{/ma}
shortdef: an animal (such as a domestic rabbit or cat) showing a genetic recessive variation in which the guard hairs are very short, sparse, or entirely lacking

dt: {bc}a flounder ({it}Errex zachirus{/it} synonym {it}Glyptocephalus zachirus{/it}) with both eyes on the right side that is an important food fish occurring from the Bering Sea to Baja California

et: probably modification of New Latin {it}Errex{/it} genus name
shortdef: a flounder (Errex zachirus synonym Glyptocephalus zachirus) with both eyes on the right side that is an important food fish occurring from the Bering Sea to Baja California

dt: {bc}any of a breed of cats with a very short soft wavy coat free of guard hairs and a small head with large ears

shortdef: any of a breed of cats with a very short soft wavy coat free of guard hairs and a small head with large ears

dt: {bc}any of a breed of large-eared cats having a very short wavy or curly coat with sparse guard hairs

shortdef: any of a breed of large-eared cats having a very short wavy or curly coat with sparse guard hairs
